Ok.. In the see saw political battle in Kanas in the board of Education, the 'Creationist' supports lost a couple of seats, and the pro-science group gained a couple.

Thank you, thank you, thank you.
 
 I feel like an idiot for not knowing this already seeing as I live in Kansas.

The sad part is four members of a board of education are still creationists. Almost as regressive as Georgia's attempt to ban the word evolution from science textbooks. No need to even mention Alabama, the 'Island of Ignorance'. More dumbing down of Amerika.

The sad part is four members of a board of education are still creationists.
Yes, but the terms do not expire at the same time. I think they elect 3 or 4 every two years. From the 1999 6-4 creationist majority (elected in 1998) the board has gone to 7-3 evolutionist majority in 2000, 5-5 in 2002, 6-4 creationist in 2004 (the board that passed the current standards), 6-4 evolutionist in 2006.

Yes, but the terms do not expire at the same time. I think they elect 3 or 4 every two years. 

 The ten seats are staggered for elections: All odd-numbered seats are voted on at a time and all even-numbered seats voted on two years later.

Ok.. In the see saw political battle in Kanas in the board of Education, the 'Creationist' supports lost a couple of seats, and the pro-science group gained a couple.
